Description: Lower body sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery large bowl; dull white slip; interior glazed black with one band in added red lined in white; exterior: goats grazing to left (one hind leg of left goat remaining; part of head and four legs of secong); pinwheel rosettes and dashes as filling ornament; below, broken maeander frieze between black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels III / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 3, pl. 3, no. 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.261)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Jean de Mot
